job_title: Entry Level Hardware and Systems Engineer
job_description: software engineering job for the role Entry Level Hardware and Systems Engineer
software engineering job for the role ASIC Digital Design Engineer

• Minimum QualificationsMinimum requirement of a bachelors degree.
• Hands-on experience with real-time, embedded software/Firmware.
• Strong software design, problem solving and debugging skills.
• Detailed understanding of software engineering principles using C and or C++, Real Time Operating Systems (RTOS) and concurrent programming.

• Minimum QualificationsBachelor’s Degree or foreign equivalent in Computer Science or related field and 3 years of experience in the job offered or related occupation.
• 3 years of experience with each of the following skills is required:Utilizing Ruby language and Ruby on Rails framework for building web appsUsing JavaScript and React to build dynamic user interfaces for toolingDebugging existing codebase to troubleshoot/resolve production issuesUtilizing RSpec to write automated test suites for new and existing codeTranslating functional requirements into simple user interface wireframesUtilizing Postgres for data modeling and query optimizationUtilizing GitHub for source code management to propose and review software changes.

• Minimum QualificationsBachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent in Systems Design Engineering.
• Experience and/or education must include:Using the Objective-C, Swift, C++ programming languages, and development tools to develop software for iOS, macOS, or VisionOS operating systems.
• Computer Science, Electrical or Systems Engineering, or related field.
• Developing user interface software, applying principles in user-interaction design.
• Analyzing and developing software to protect user privacy and prevent devices from being compromised by malicious software by applying secure design principles including permission controls, access restriction, and data encryption.
• Utilizing concurrent, client-server software to develop new frameworks and services for system software.
• Analyzing and fixing flaws in existing system software using Xcode and lldb debugging tools.
• Using Stash and Github software management tools and propose architectural and algorithm improvements.

• Minimum QualificationsMaster's degree or foreign equivalent in Computer Science, Computer and Information Technology, or a related field and 6 months of experience in the job offered or a related position.
• Experience and/or education must include:Using object-oriented languages for user experience including C++ and C#.
• Tracking down experience regressions from code changes introduced outside of the user’s codebase effectively and efficiently using development framework plus source control such as Git and Perforce.
• Using multi-threaded application architecture including GCD and Actors to build performant and stable user applications.
• Debugging memory and threading issues that could arise in application development using tools including Visual Studio and Xcode memory and concurrency tools.
• Building 3D applications using ECS systems including Reality Kit or Unity.
• Maintaining code coverage through new unit testing of new features and extension of existing unit tests through frameworks including XCTest or MSTest.
• Optimizing power, performance, quality and usability simultaneously using a combination of telemetry and tooling as part of CI/CD suite.
